what: [Tame Impala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tame_Impala) performs at Meredith Music Festival. Stu is in the crowd, and is so inspired that he went home to start a band.
[Thee Oh Sees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osees) perform in Melbourne; the audience is mostly made up of future King Gizzard members who were all heavily inspired by the show.
King Gizzard win the first Carlton Dry Global Music Grant, allowing them to tour internationally for the first time (starting in April 2014).
King Gizzard win the Best Hard Rock/Heavy Metal Album ARIA Award for _Nonagon Infinity_. (Other nominees included: Hellions, Parkway Drive, The Amity Affliction, and Twelve Foot Ninja.)

Stu & Eric acknowledge the Gizzverse for the first time in a radio interview on Triple J: "[The albums] all exist in this parallel universe and theyâ€™re maybe from different times and different places but they all can co-exist in a meaningful way."
The Flightless Records website crashes under the demand of pre-orders for the vinyl re-pressing of the band's first five full-length albums.
Eric Moore announces his departure from the band to focus on Flightless Records full time, and the band return to self-publishing.
King Gizzard win the Best Hard Rock/Heavy Metal Album ARIA Award for _Chunky Shrapnel_. (Other nominees included: Parkway Drive, Polaris, The Amity Affliction, and The Chats.)
The Official Bootlegger program is launched.
King Gizzard win the first Environmental Music Prize, and donate the winnings to The Wilderness Society.
On-demand streaming release of the short film [Sleeping Monster](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-4wn6PUskhI).
